sub_title: Lecturer in Business English Communication at The Hague University of Applied Sciences
summary:
I currently work as a lecturer in English at The Hague University of Applied Sciences in the International Business and Management Studies programme. I'm responsible for planning and delivering lectures, curriculum development, and creating and evaluating examinations.

For two years before that, I was a freelance lecturer in English at the Hotelschool Den Haag and the James Boswell Institute at the University of Utrecht.

From 2005-2013, I was a business English teacher in the Netherlands. During that time, I taught students of all ability levels in all fields of work. I also tested students' ability levels and designed individual programs and materials to suit their needs.

I am a volunteer French-English translator for Solidarités, a French NGO, and for Translators without borders.

Finally, as I have successfully sat the Diplôme Approfondi de Langue Française (DALF) level C1, I am qualified to teach French at the beginner and intermediate level.

Specialties: Translation of business or social sciences documents from French into English.
